javadoc: A class to compute the first and follow of every non-terminal in a grammar See Alfred V. Aho, Monica S. Lam, Ravi Sethi, Jeffrey D. Ullman, Compilers: Principles, Techniques, & Tools. Bostom, MA: Pearson, 2007, pp. 220-2.

methods.javadoc:
Compute the first and follow sets for every non-terminal in the given grammar
@param grammar the grammar
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Compute the first and follow sets for every non-terminal in the given grammar

methods.javadoc: Compute the first set for each non-terminal
methods.name: computeFirsts
methods.comment: Compute the first set for each non-terminal

methods.javadoc: Compute the follow set for each non-terminal
methods.name: computeFollows
methods.comment: Compute the follow set for each non-terminal

methods.name: getNullable
methods.comment:
Get the nullable set
 
 That is the set of all non-terminals, which through some derivation, can produce epsilon.

methods.name: getFirst
methods.comment:
Get the first set for a given non-terminal
 
 That is the set of all terminals, which through some derivation from the given non-terminal,
 can appear first in a sentential form.

methods.name: getFollow
methods.comment:
Get the follow set for a given non-terminal
 
 That is the set of all terminals, which through some derivation from the start symbol, can
 appear immediately after the given non-terminal in a sentential form.

methods.javadoc:
For debugging, print out the computed sets to the given stream
@param out the stream
methods.name: print
methods.comment: For debugging, print out the computed sets to the given stream

name: AssemblyFirstFollow
comment:
A class to compute the first and follow of every non-terminal in a grammar
 
 See Alfred V. Aho, Monica S. Lam, Ravi Sethi, Jeffrey D. Ullman, Compilers: Principles,
 Techniques,  Tools. Bostom, MA: Pearson, 2007, pp. 220-2.
